storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review schedule change requests to achieve informed decision-making

testCases.title: Display pending schedule change requests to approver
preconditions: User has valid approver credentials
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
User has appropriate role-based access permissions
Network connectivity is available

steps.action: Approver logs into the system using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully within 3 seconds and displays the main navigation menu

steps.action: Navigate to approval dashboard by clicking on the approval dashboard menu option
steps.expectedResult: List of pending schedule change requests is displayed showing request ID, requester name, submission date, and current status

steps.action: Select a request from the list to view details by clicking on the request row
steps.expectedResult: Detailed information is displayed including requester details, requested changes, attachments, comments, and request history

postconditions: Approver remains logged in
Request details page is displayed
No changes are made to request status

testCases.title: Approve a schedule change request
preconditions: User is logged in as an approver
At least one pending schedule change request exists
User has authorization to approve requests
Approver is on the approval dashboard

steps.action: Select a pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing all relevant information including requester name, requested changes, attachments, and current status as 'Pending'

steps.action: Click the 'Approve' button and add optional comments in the comments text field
steps.expectedResult: Approve action is accepted, comments field is populated, and the submit button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button to confirm the approval decision
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Approved', decision is logged with timestamp and approver details, confirmation message is displayed, and notification is sent to the requester

postconditions: Request status is changed to 'Approved' in the database
Approval action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp
Requester receives notification of approval
Request is removed from pending list on dashboard

testCases.title: Reject a schedule change request with comments
preconditions: User is logged in as an approver
At least one pending schedule change request exists
User has authorization to reject requests
Approver is on the approval dashboard

steps.action: Select a pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing all relevant information including requester name, requested changes, attachments, and current status as 'Pending'

steps.action: Click the 'Reject' button and enter a rejection reason in the mandatory comments field
steps.expectedResult: Reject action is accepted, rejection reason is entered in the comments field, and the submit button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button to confirm the rejection decision
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Rejected', decision is logged with timestamp and approver details, rejection reason is saved, confirmation message is displayed, and notification is sent to the requester

postconditions: Request status is changed to 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp and comments
Requester receives notification of rejection with reason
Request is removed from pending list on dashboard

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view the status of my schedule change requests to achieve transparency and timely updates

testCases.title: Display schedule change requests and statuses for scheduler
preconditions: User has valid scheduler credentials
Scheduler has submitted at least one schedule change request
User has appropriate role-based access permissions
Network connectivity is available

steps.action: Scheduler logs into the system using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: 'My Schedule Changes' page loads successfully within 3 seconds and displays the navigation menu

steps.action: View the list of submitted schedule change requests on the 'My Schedule Changes' page
steps.expectedResult: All requests submitted by the logged-in scheduler are displayed with columns showing request ID, submission date, type, current status (Pending, Approved, Rejected, or Escalated), and last updated timestamp

steps.action: Select a specific request from the list by clicking on it to view detailed approval history
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view is displayed showing complete approval history including all approval actions, approver names, decision timestamps, and any comments provided by approvers

postconditions: Scheduler remains logged in
Request details page is displayed
No changes are made to any request status
Only scheduler's own requests are visible

testCases.title: Filter and sort schedule change requests
preconditions: User is logged in as a scheduler
Scheduler is on the 'My Schedule Changes' page
Multiple schedule change requests exist with different statuses and dates
At least one request has 'Pending' status

steps.action: On 'My Schedule Changes' page, locate the status filter dropdown and select 'Pending' from the available options
steps.expectedResult: Only requests with 'Pending' status are displayed in the list, all other status requests are filtered out, and the count of displayed requests updates accordingly

steps.action: Click on the 'Submission Date' column header to sort requests by submission date in descending order
steps.expectedResult: Requests are sorted correctly with the most recent submission date appearing first, and a descending sort indicator is displayed on the column header

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button to remove all applied filters and sorting
steps.expectedResult: All schedule change requests submitted by the scheduler are displayed again in the default order (typically by submission date descending), and filter selections are reset to default values

postconditions: All filters and sorting are cleared
Full list of scheduler's requests is visible
Page displays default view
No data is modified

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to escalate schedule change requests to higher authority to achieve timely resolution

testCases.title: Escalate a schedule change request successfully
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
User has permission to escalate requests
Higher-level approvers are configured in the system
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully displaying list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Select a schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed including requester information, schedule details, and current status

steps.action: Click the 'Escalate' button
steps.expectedResult: Escalation dialog box opens with a comments text field and submit/cancel buttons

steps.action: Enter escalation comments in the text field (e.g., 'Requires senior management approval due to budget implications')
steps.expectedResult: Escalation comments are accepted and displayed in the text field without validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button to submit the escalation
steps.expectedResult: System processes the escalation within 2 seconds, request status updates to 'Escalated', success message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the request status on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request status shows 'Escalated' with timestamp and escalation indicator

steps.action: Check that notification was sent to higher-level approvers
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to next-level approvers within 1 minute containing request details and escalation comments

steps.action: Review audit logs for the escalation action
steps.expectedResult: Escalation action is logged in audit logs with timestamp, approver user details, and escalation comments

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Escalated'
Higher-level approvers have been notified
Escalation action is recorded in audit logs with complete details
Original approver can view escalation history on the request

testCases.title: Reject escalation with missing comments
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
At least one schedule change request exists in pending status
User has permission to escalate requests
Escalation comments are configured as mandatory field

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully displaying list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Select a schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with available actions including 'Escalate' button

steps.action: Click the 'Escalate' button
steps.expectedResult: Escalation dialog box opens with an empty comments text field

steps.action: Leave the comments field empty and click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed: 'Escalation comments are required' or similar, submission is blocked

steps.action: Attempt to submit escalation again without entering comments
steps.expectedResult: Submission remains blocked, validation error persists, escalation dialog stays open

steps.action: Verify that the request status has not changed
steps.expectedResult: Request status remains in original state (not 'Escalated'), no escalation action recorded

steps.action: Enter valid comments in the text field (e.g., 'Escalating for policy review')
steps.expectedResult: Validation error clears, comments are accepted

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button with valid comments
steps.expectedResult: Escalation is successfully submitted, request status updates to 'Escalated'

postconditions: System enforces mandatory comments validation for escalations
No incomplete escalation records are created in the system
Request status only changes after valid escalation submission

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure approval workflow rules to achieve flexible and compliant schedule change processing

testCases.title: Create and save new approval workflow configuration
preconditions: User is logged in with System Administrator role
User has access to workflow configuration module
WorkflowConfig database tables are accessible
No pending workflow configuration changes exist
System is in stable state with no ongoing deployments

steps.action: Log into the system with administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and lands on admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the workflow configuration page from the admin menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration UI loads successfully displaying current workflow settings and configuration options

steps.action: Click 'Add New Approval Level' button
steps.expectedResult: New approval level form appears with fields for level name, sequence order, and role assignment

steps.action: Enter approval level details: Level Name = 'Senior Management Approval', Sequence = '3', Role = 'Senior Manager'
steps.expectedResult: Input fields accept the values without validation errors, data is displayed correctly in the form

steps.action: Click 'Add Role' to assign additional roles to the approval level
steps.expectedResult: Role selection dropdown appears with available system roles

steps.action: Select 'Director' role from the dropdown and add it to the approval level
steps.expectedResult: Director role is added to the approval level, both Senior Manager and Director roles are displayed

steps.action: Define escalation path by selecting 'Escalates to: Executive Level' from the escalation dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Escalation path is configured and displayed in the workflow diagram

steps.action: Review the complete workflow configuration in the preview panel
steps.expectedResult: Preview shows all approval levels, assigned roles, and escalation paths in logical sequence

steps.action: Click 'Save Configuration' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the configuration for consistency, validation passes with no errors

steps.action: Confirm the save action in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully, success message displays: 'Workflow configuration saved and will be applied within 5 minutes'

steps.action: Wait for 5 minutes and refresh the workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: New configuration is active and displayed as current workflow, changes are applied without system downtime

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs and search for workflow configuration changes
steps.expectedResult: Configuration change is logged with administrator username, timestamp, and details of changes made

postconditions: New approval workflow configuration is saved in WorkflowConfig tables
Configuration is applied and active in the system within 5 minutes
All configuration changes are logged in audit logs
System remains operational with no downtime
New approval level is available for schedule change requests

testCases.title: Reject invalid workflow configuration
preconditions: User is logged in with System Administrator role
User has access to workflow configuration module
Existing valid workflow configuration is in place
Validation rules are configured for workflow consistency

steps.action: Log into the system with administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and accesses admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration UI loads with current workflow settings displayed

steps.action: Click 'Add New Approval Level' to create a new level
steps.expectedResult: New approval level form appears ready for input

steps.action: Enter approval level: Level Name = 'Department Head', Sequence = '2', Role = 'Department Manager'
steps.expectedResult: Approval level details are entered and displayed in the form

steps.action: Configure escalation path to point to a non-existent approval level: 'Escalates to: Non-Existent Level'
steps.expectedResult: Escalation path input accepts the entry temporarily

steps.action: Create another approval level with the same sequence number '2' as an existing level
steps.expectedResult: Duplicate sequence number is entered in the form

steps.action: Click 'Save Configuration' button
steps.expectedResult: System performs validation and displays validation errors: 'Escalation path references non-existent approval level' and 'Duplicate sequence numbers detected'

steps.action: Review the validation error messages displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Clear, specific error messages are shown for each validation failure with guidance on how to resolve

steps.action: Attempt to save the configuration again without making corrections
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked, validation errors persist, configuration is not saved to database

steps.action: Verify that the original workflow configuration remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Current active workflow configuration is unchanged, no partial updates applied

steps.action: Correct the errors: Change escalation path to valid existing level and update sequence number to '4'
steps.expectedResult: Corrections are accepted, validation errors clear from the screen

steps.action: Click 'Save Configuration' button with corrected data
steps.expectedResult: Validation passes, configuration is saved successfully, success message is displayed

postconditions: Invalid configuration is rejected and not saved to the system
Original workflow configuration remains intact and operational
No partial or inconsistent configuration data exists in the database
Administrator is informed of specific validation errors
System maintains data integrity throughout the validation process

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive notifications about schedule change approval decisions to achieve timely awareness

testCases.title: Receive notification on approval decision
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the system
Scheduler has submitted a schedule change request with valid details
Schedule change request is in 'Pending' status
Approver has appropriate permissions to approve requests
Notification service is operational
Scheduler's email address is configured in user profile
In-app notification feature is enabled

steps.action: Approver logs into the system and navigates to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approver successfully accesses the approval dashboard and sees the pending schedule change request

steps.action: Approver selects the schedule change request submitted by the scheduler
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with all relevant information including requester name, date, and change details

steps.action: Approver adds comments 'Approved as requested - no conflicts identified' and clicks the 'Approve' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message that the decision has been recorded and request status changes to 'Approved'

steps.action: System automatically triggers notification service within 1 minute of approval
steps.expectedResult: Notification service processes the approval decision and queues email and in-app notifications for the scheduler

steps.action: Scheduler checks email inbox within 1 minute of approval
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler receives email notification with subject line indicating approval, including decision details and approver comments

steps.action: Scheduler logs into the system and checks in-app notifications
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification badge shows unread notification count, notification appears in notification center

steps.action: Scheduler clicks on the in-app notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays complete decision information including: approval status, approver name, timestamp, comments 'Approved as requested - no conflicts identified', and link to view full request details

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Approved'
Scheduler has received both email and in-app notifications
Notification delivery timestamp is within 1 minute of approval decision
Notification is marked as delivered in the system
Audit log records notification sent event

testCases.title: Receive notification on rejection decision
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the system
Scheduler has submitted a schedule change request with valid details
Schedule change request is in 'Pending' status
Approver has appropriate permissions to reject requests
Notification service is operational
Scheduler's email address is configured in user profile
In-app notification feature is enabled

steps.action: Approver logs into the system and navigates to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approver successfully accesses the approval dashboard and sees the pending schedule change request

steps.action: Approver selects the schedule change request submitted by the scheduler
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with all relevant information including requester name, date, and change details

steps.action: Approver adds comments 'Rejected due to insufficient staffing coverage during requested period' and clicks the 'Reject' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message that the decision has been recorded and request status changes to 'Rejected'

steps.action: System automatically triggers notification service within 1 minute of rejection
steps.expectedResult: Notification service processes the rejection decision and queues email and in-app notifications for the scheduler

steps.action: Scheduler checks email inbox within 1 minute of rejection
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler receives email notification with subject line indicating rejection, including decision details and approver comments

steps.action: Scheduler logs into the system and checks in-app notifications
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification badge shows unread notification count, notification appears in notification center with rejection indicator

steps.action: Scheduler clicks on the in-app notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays complete decision information including: rejection status, approver name, timestamp, comments 'Rejected due to insufficient staffing coverage during requested period', and link to view full request details

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Rejected'
Scheduler has received both email and in-app notifications
Notification delivery timestamp is within 1 minute of rejection decision
Notification is marked as delivered in the system
Audit log records notification sent event
Original schedule remains unchanged

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to filter and search schedule change requests to achieve efficient workload management

testCases.title: Filter schedule change requests by status and date
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate permissions to view schedule change requests
Multiple schedule change requests exist in the system with varying statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
Schedule change requests exist with different submission dates spanning more than 7 days
At least 3 requests with 'Pending' status exist within the last 7 days
Approval dashboard is accessible and fully loaded

steps.action: Approver navigates to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests in default view with filter options visible

steps.action: Approver locates the status filter dropdown and selects 'Pending' from the available options
steps.expectedResult: Status filter is applied and dropdown shows 'Pending' as selected value

steps.action: Approver locates the date range filter and selects 'Last 7 days' option
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied showing date range from current date minus 7 days to current date

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the filter request and displays filtered results within 2 seconds showing only requests with 'Pending' status submitted within the last 7 days

steps.action: Approver verifies the filtered list by checking status and date columns of displayed requests
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests show 'Pending' status and submission dates within the last 7 days, no requests outside filter criteria are shown

steps.action: Approver notes the response time from clicking 'Apply Filters' to results display
steps.expectedResult: Results are returned and displayed within 2 seconds as per performance requirement

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Clear Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: All filters are removed, filter dropdowns reset to default values, and full unfiltered list of all schedule change requests is displayed

postconditions: Filters are cleared and system returns to default view
All schedule change requests are visible without any filtering applied
Filter controls are reset to default state
System performance remains within acceptable limits

testCases.title: Search schedule change requests by keyword
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate permissions to view schedule change requests
Multiple schedule change requests exist in the system
At least 3 requests contain the keyword 'maintenance' in their details, comments, or description fields
Search functionality is enabled on the approval dashboard
Approval dashboard is accessible and fully loaded

steps.action: Approver navigates to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests with search box visible at the top of the request list

steps.action: Approver locates the search box and clicks inside it to activate the search field
steps.expectedResult: Search box is activated, cursor appears in the field, and placeholder text is visible

steps.action: Approver types the keyword 'maintenance' into the search box
steps.expectedResult: Text 'maintenance' appears in the search box as typed, character by character

steps.action: Approver presses Enter key or clicks the search icon button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates search query and displays loading indicator while processing

steps.action: System processes the search and returns results
steps.expectedResult: Search results are displayed within 2 seconds showing only schedule change requests that contain the keyword 'maintenance' in any of their detail fields

steps.action: Approver reviews the search results and verifies each displayed request contains the keyword 'maintenance'
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests contain 'maintenance' in description, comments, or other detail fields, with the keyword highlighted or emphasized in the results

steps.action: Approver notes the response time from initiating search to results display
steps.expectedResult: Search results are returned and displayed within 2 seconds as per performance requirement

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Clear Search' button or deletes text from search box and presses Enter
steps.expectedResult: Search is cleared, search box is empty, and full unfiltered list of all schedule change requests is displayed

postconditions: Search is cleared and system returns to default view
All schedule change requests are visible without any search filtering applied
Search box is empty and ready for new search input
System performance remains within acceptable limits

testCases.title: Save and reuse filter presets
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate permissions to view and manage schedule change requests
Filter preset functionality is enabled for the approver role
Multiple schedule change requests exist with varying priorities and statuses
At least 3 requests with 'High' priority and 'Pending' status exist in the system
Approval dashboard is accessible and fully loaded
Approver has not previously saved a preset named 'Urgent Requests'

steps.action: Approver navigates to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests with filter options and preset management controls visible

steps.action: Approver applies multiple filters: selects 'Pending' from status dropdown and 'High' from priority dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Both filters are applied and displayed as active filters in the filter panel

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Apply Filters' button to view filtered results
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list displays only requests with 'Pending' status and 'High' priority within 2 seconds

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Save Preset' or 'Save Filter' button
steps.expectedResult: Dialog box or modal appears prompting for preset name and optional description

steps.action: Approver enters preset name 'Urgent Requests' in the name field
steps.expectedResult: Text 'Urgent Requests' appears in the preset name field

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Save' button in the preset dialog
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message 'Preset saved successfully', dialog closes, and 'Urgent Requests' appears in the saved presets list or dropdown

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Clear Filters' to reset the view
steps.expectedResult: All filters are cleared and full unfiltered list of schedule change requests is displayed

steps.action: Approver locates the saved presets dropdown or list and selects 'Urgent Requests' preset
steps.expectedResult: Preset 'Urgent Requests' is selected from the list

steps.action: Approver clicks 'Load Preset' or 'Apply' button
steps.expectedResult: System automatically applies the saved filters (Status: Pending, Priority: High) and displays matching requests within 2 seconds

steps.action: Approver verifies that the loaded preset displays the same filtered results as when originally saved
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list shows only requests with 'Pending' status and 'High' priority, matching the original filter criteria

postconditions: Filter preset 'Urgent Requests' is saved in the system and associated with the approver's profile
Preset is available for future use in the saved presets list
Current view displays filtered results based on the loaded preset
Preset can be edited or deleted by the approver
System audit log records preset creation event

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to manage user roles and permissions for approval workflows to achieve secure and compliant access control

testCases.title: Assign and enforce user roles
preconditions: Admin user is authenticated and logged into the system
User management console is accessible
Test user account exists in the system without 'Approver' role
UserRoles and Permissions tables are properly configured
Approval dashboard is available and functional

steps.action: Navigate to user management console as Admin
steps.expectedResult: User management console loads successfully displaying list of users and their current roles

steps.action: Search for and select the test user from the user list
steps.expectedResult: Test user profile is displayed with current role information

steps.action: Click on 'Edit Roles' or 'Assign Role' button for the selected user
steps.expectedResult: Role assignment interface opens showing available roles (Scheduler, Approver, Auditor, Admin)

steps.action: Select 'Approver' role from the available roles list
steps.expectedResult: 'Approver' role is highlighted/selected in the interface

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to confirm role assignment
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming role assignment. Role change is saved to UserRoles table and logged with admin username and timestamp

steps.action: Verify the audit log for the role change entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows new entry with user ID, assigned role 'Approver', admin who made the change, and timestamp

steps.action: Log out from admin account and log in as the test user with newly assigned 'Approver' role
steps.expectedResult: Test user successfully logs into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully showing pending approval requests and approval actions available to 'Approver' role

steps.action: Attempt to perform an action restricted to 'Approver' role (e.g., approve a pending schedule change)
steps.expectedResult: Action is permitted and executes successfully, confirming 'Approver' permissions are enforced

steps.action: Attempt to access an unauthorized action for 'Approver' role (e.g., access admin configuration settings or user management console)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message (e.g., 'You do not have permission to access this resource' or 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that unauthorized action attempt is logged in security audit log
steps.expectedResult: Security audit log contains entry of unauthorized access attempt with user ID, attempted action, and timestamp

postconditions: Test user has 'Approver' role assigned in the system
Role assignment is logged in audit trail
User can access Approver-specific functions
User cannot access functions outside Approver permissions
All access attempts are properly logged

testCases.title: Restrict role management access
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Non-admin test user account exists and is authenticated
Admin test user account exists and is authenticated
Role management page URL is known
Access control is properly configured to restrict role management to admins only

steps.action: Log into the system as a non-admin user (e.g., user with 'Scheduler' or 'Approver' role)
steps.expectedResult: Non-admin user successfully logs into the system and lands on their default dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the role management page by entering the URL directly in the browser or clicking on role management link if visible
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. System displays error message such as 'Access Denied - Insufficient Permissions' or 'You must be an administrator to access this page'. HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned

steps.action: Verify that role management navigation option is not visible in the user interface for non-admin user
steps.expectedResult: Role management menu item or link is not displayed in navigation menu or sidebar for non-admin user

steps.action: Attempt to access role management API endpoint directly (GET /api/user-roles) using non-admin credentials
steps.expectedResult: API request is rejected with 403 Forbidden status and appropriate error message in response body

steps.action: Verify that the unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit log
steps.expectedResult: Security audit log contains entry showing non-admin user attempted to access role management with timestamp and denial status

steps.action: Log out from non-admin account and log in as an admin user
steps.expectedResult: Admin user successfully logs into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the role management page using the same URL or navigation link
steps.expectedResult: Role management page loads successfully displaying user list, roles, and management controls

steps.action: Verify that all role management functions are accessible (view users, assign roles, modify roles)
steps.expectedResult: Admin can view complete user list with current roles, access role assignment interface, and all management functions are enabled and functional

steps.action: Access role management API endpoint (GET /api/user-roles) using admin credentials
steps.expectedResult: API request succeeds with 200 OK status and returns user roles data in response

steps.action: Verify admin access is logged in audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows admin user accessed role management page with timestamp

postconditions: Non-admin users remain unable to access role management functions
Admin users retain full access to role management
All access attempts (both denied and granted) are logged in audit trail
System security posture is maintained with proper access controls enforced
